channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump confirms U.S. strike on alleged Venezuelan drug boat
item.description: President Trump says the U.S. military has struck a drug-laden vessel in the southern Caribbean after it left Venezuela. The strike comes a week after Washington deployed warships to the region.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says the U.S. military has struck a drug-laden vessel in the southern Caribbean after it left Venezuela. The strike comes a week after Washington deployed warships to the region.

(Image credit: Daniel Gonzalez)
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: In a major antitrust ruling, a judge lets Google keep Chrome but levies other penalties
item.description: A federal judge ruled against breaking up Google, but is barring it from making exclusive deals to make its search engine the default on phones and other devices.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge ruled against breaking up Google, but is barring it from making exclusive deals to make its search engine the default on phones and other devices.

(Image credit: Sergi Gapon)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Military lawyers called up to relieve a shortfall in immigration judges
item.description: The move comes after the Justice Department last week made changes to who could qualify as a temporary immigration judge —effectively lowering the requirements and removing the need to have prior immigration experience.
item.content:encoded:
The move comes after the Justice Department last week made changes to who could qualify as a temporary immigration judge —effectively lowering the requirements and removing the need to have prior immigration experience.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Trump says Space Command will move to Alabama, after long battle over its HQ
item.description: President Trump announced he intends to move U.S. Space Command headquarters to Huntsville, Ala., after a protracted battle over whether it would stay in Colorado, as former President Joe Biden advocated.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump announced he intends to move U.S. Space Command headquarters to Huntsville, Ala., after a protracted battle over whether it would stay in Colorado, as former President Joe Biden advocated.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Pat Duggins

item.title: Trump administration blocks groups from voter registration at naturalization events
item.description: Nongovernmental groups like the League of Women Voters are now barred from registering new voters at naturalization ceremonies, the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has announced.
item.content:encoded:
Nongovernmental groups like the League of Women Voters are now barred from registering new voters at naturalization ceremonies, the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services has announced.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Tick tock: Congress has 14 legislative days to stop a government shutdown
item.description: Congressional lawmakers return to D.C. with a massive September agenda, including efforts to avoid a government shutdown and a debate on whether to change the rules for confirming nominees.
item.content:encoded:
Congressional lawmakers return to D.C. with a massive September agenda, including efforts to avoid a government shutdown and a debate on whether to change the rules for confirming nominees.

(Image credit: J. David Ake/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: How rural hospitals are banding together to survive
item.description: Independent and rural hospitals are collaborating with their neighbors to shore up their finances instead of joining larger health systems to stay afloat.
item.content:encoded:
Independent and rural hospitals are collaborating with their neighbors to shore up their finances instead of joining larger health systems to stay afloat.

(Image credit: Arielle Zionts/KFF Health News)
item.dc:creator: Arielle Zionts

item.title: Vogue promotes Chloe Malle to top editor spot
item.description: Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer.
item.content:encoded:
Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer.

(Image credit: Evan Agostini)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong

item.title: As many as 1,000 killed in Sudan landslide
item.description: Up to 1,000 dead after a landslide levels a village in western Sudan, as displaced residents flee famine and war.
item.content:encoded:
Up to 1,000 dead after a landslide levels a village in western Sudan, as displaced residents flee famine and war.

(Image credit: Sudan Liberation Movement)
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Judge rules against National Guard in LA, and Trump vows to send them to Chicago
item.description: After a federal court in California ruled that President Trump's use of the National Guard in Los Angeles was illegal, Trump touted his use of the Guard in Washington, D.C., and said Chicago is next.
item.content:encoded:
After a federal court in California ruled that President Trump's use of the National Guard in Los Angeles was illegal, Trump touted his use of the Guard in Washington, D.C., and said Chicago is next.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Larry Kaplow
